c74object.name: somax.player
c74object.digest: Monitor and control different regions to navigate the corpus
c74object.description: The somax.regions module should be connected in a loop with the somax.player and is used to monitor the playback and to dynamically interact with the corpus to guide the generation of the next event. Regions can be edited, enabled, disabled and resized according to your needs, providing precise and dynamic selection of different sections of the corpus, and offering tools to structure your interaction.

objarg.name: buffername
objarg.description:
This mandatory argument sets the name of the buffer~ used by the somax.audiorecord to record the audio input in.
When using somax.regions through a bpatcher, buffer name should be configured in the Max Inspector, by setting Argument(s) to @buffername name_of_your_buffer.
What happens if there's no argument?

method.name: editable
method.description: The message editable followed by an int between 1 and 6 sets the corresponding region as editable.

method.name: enabled
method.description:
The message enabled is used to enable or disable a specific region. The syntax is enabled index state, where index is the number of the region (between 1 and 6) you want to enable or disable, and state is 1 if enabled, 0 if disabled.
Regions can be enabled or disabled one at a time (i.e., the message enabled 1 0 will disable region 1), or by sending compound enabled messages separated by a comma.

method.name: reset
method.description:
The message reset followed by an int between 1 and 6 reset the corresponding region to its original size.
The message reset, without any argument, resets all the six regions to their default values, equally dividing them according to the corpus's length.

method.name: bounds
method.description:
The message bounds sets the bounds, and thus the size, of a specific region.
The syntax is bounds index start_ms end_ms where index is the number of the region (between 1 and 6) and start_ms and end_ms are the start and end time (in ms) of the region.
I.e., the message bounds 1 0. 6000. will resize region 1 with start bound at 0 ms and end bound at 6000 ms, selecting the first 6 seconds of the corpus.
